intro: Tithymalus virgultosus, commonly known as the lesser tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Tithymalus virgultosus is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
